shows.title: My Neighbor, Johnny Carson / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Retired tech executive Howard Smith had his life take a remarkable turn when he moved to Malibu, California, and became close friends with his neighbor, Johnny Carson. Howard will bring us the details and share stories of his experience being friends with the legendary King of Late Night TV. Followed by Open Lines. Give George Noory a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!

shows.title: Alien Abduction Panel
shows.guests: Bret Oldham, Philip Kinsella, Paul Sinclair
shows.first_half: In this special broadcast, Connie Willis (info) hosts an Alien Abduction Panel, delving deep into this mysterious phenomenon. The panel includes Bret Oldham, who has been featured in numerous alien abductee documentaries and TV shows, Philip Kinsella, clairvoyant medium and UFO investigator, who is a well-known abductee along with his twin brother, and UK-based author and researcher Paul Sinclair. A fourth surprise guest will also join the conversation.
shows.second_half: 6-10pm PT: Art Bell - Somewhere in Time returns to 2/14/02 when Dr. Philip M. Tierno discussed bacteria, viruses, and prions and their myriad effects.

shows.title: Medical Supernatural Stories / Manifestation & the Soul
shows.guests: Dr. Scott Kolbaba, Jill M. Jackson
shows.first_half: First Half: Internal medicine physician Scott Kolbaba, MD, joins George Noory to discuss miraculous and often supernatural true stories from practicing doctors. He'll also touch on his most recent book, "Clara’s Magic Garden," a story of post-pandemic teen depression with transformation and healing in a mystical garden.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author, psychic medium, and spiritual teacher Jill M. Jackson speaks about manifestation and the steps we must take to recognize the value of the gifts we've been given in life, as well as the soul and self-discovery.

shows.title: Gravity & Health / Nature of Angels
shows.first_half: First Half: Dr. Brennan Spiegel is a physician, Professor of Medicine, and research scientist at Cedars-Sinai in Los Angeles. He'll be discussing the hidden ways gravity influences everything from digestion to depression, and how building gravity resilience can help us find balance, stand stronger, and live longer.
shows.second_half: Second Half: UFO expert, remote viewer, and health & wellness practitioner Christopher Macklin will explore the nature of angels, including their purpose and relationship to humanity.

shows.title: Natural Remedies / Folklore, Magic, & Plants
shows.first_half: First Half: Pharmacist Ben Fuchs will discuss natural health remedies and the vitamins, nutrients, and minerals that our bodies need to maintain good health.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author, traveler, lover of the strange, Varla Ventura will talk about her latest works on folklore, magic, and the supernatural, as well as her exploration of the cultural and mythological significance of plants.

shows.title: Green Energy Critique / Paranormal Realities
shows.first_half: First Half: Author Steve Goreham, Executive Director of the Climate Science Coalition of America, argues that the theory of man-made global warming and climate change is inaccurate, and warns of a coming green energy breakdown, with stresses placed on the grid due to rising demand for electric power.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Researcher of paranormal mysteries and cover-ups, Andy Thomas, will discuss the implications of his new book "Strange: Paranormal Realities in the Everyday World," which records and analyzes the many paranormal experiences being experienced by a huge number of very ordinary people.

shows.title: Close Encounters / Crop Circle Mysteries
shows.first_half: First Half: Author of over 25 bestselling books, Whitley Strieber has been a longtime supporter of alternative concepts. He is an expert in diverse subjects, including strange implants, the afterlife, and aliens. He'll share his latest close encounters as well as developments in disclosure.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Patty Greer is a filmmaker, public speaker, and researcher of crop circles and plasma science. She'll discuss crop circles and how they are conceived and delivered, based on years of fieldwork and collaboration with Penny Kelly, who worked closely with the scientist W.C. Levengood.

shows.title: Open Lines
shows.first_half: In the first half, Richard Syrett will speak with guest(s) to be announced. Followed by Open Lines. Give Richard Syrett a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
